data.title: Notice near LE1, LE18 and 6 more
data.meta_description: Traffic & Roads Notice near LE1, LE18 and 6 more to read, save and share
data.text:
Leicester City Council (Moving Articles, Leicester) (Articles for Moving Traffc Prohibitions, Restrictions and Provisions) Traffc Regulation Order 2024

NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN Leicester City Council (“the Council”) proposes to make an Order under Sections 1(1), 2, 4(1) (2), 5, and Part IV of Schedule 9 and having regard to Section 122 of the Road Traffc Regulation Act 1984 (“the Act”) and of all other enabling powers, and being satisfed that, after consultation with the Chief Offcer of Police in accordance with Part III of Schedule 9 to the Act, hereby propose to makes the following Order:-

1) To introduce new interpretations related to map schedules: -

• “Map Schedule” means the Map Schedule being a collection of Map Tiles listed in Schedule 2, which depicts the traffc movement prohibitions and restrictions designated by this Order, and in conjunction with the Map Tile Label and Map Schedule Legend, identifes the type of each particular prohibition and restriction and, if appropriate, certain of its governing provisions. Provided that the Council does not accept responsibility for inaccuracies contained in the Ordnance Survey data relied upon to create the Map Schedule and where a Prohibition or Restriction is depicted on the Map Schedule, that provision continues to apply irrespective of any subsequent changes that have been made to the underlying Ordnance Survey data;

• “Map Schedule Legend” means the Map Schedule Legend to this Order which, when used in conjunction with a Map Tile as listed in Schedule 2, identifes the specifc type of traffc movement prohibition or restriction designated by this Order and, where appropriate, certain of their governing provisions;

• “Map Tile” means an individual Map Tile with a specifc Map Tile Reference, being part of the Map Schedule as listed in Schedule 2 to this Order;

• “Map Tile Label”, where shown on a Map Tile forming part of the Map Schedule in relation to a traffc movement prohibition or restriction, means a label which indicates the type of prohibition or restriction and, if appropriate giving Prescribed Hours, exemptions and Permit Identifer;

2) To revoke existing moving articles covering prohibitions, restrictions and provisions for both Consolidation Orders of 1975 and 2006.

A COPY of the proposed Order Articles, the relevant plan, the Council’s statement of reasons for proposing to make the Order and extract copies of the Order being amended may be seen at Leicester City Council’s website: leicester.gov.uk/traffcregulationorders .

OBJECTIONS to the proposed Order should be sent to ian.nash@leicester.gov.uk or email TROteam@leicester.gov.uk and mark for the attention of Ian Nash. Any objections stating grounds on which they are made and quoting ref. No. (City - Moving Articles) must be received by me by the 30th day of July 2024.

The moving articles introducing new interpretations and reference to map schedules, tiles and key.

This Order does not introduce any new moving prohibitions, restrictions or provisions within the City of Leicester. The new articles will support Map Schedules under a new Consolidation Order that will be introduced later this year.

THIS NOTICE IS DATED THIS 05th DAY OF JULY 2024

Andrew L Smith Director of Planning Development and Transportation, Leicester City Council, City Hall, 115 Charles Street, Leicester, LE1 1FZ
